lead_paragraph: A measure that would eliminate the requirement that public notices be printed in newspapers could save more than $60 million, the governor’s office says.

headline.print_headline: Christie Blamed for Bill  Paring Papers’ Legal Ads
headline.main: News Media Blame Christie for Bill That Could Devastate Newspapers

snippet: A measure that would eliminate the requirement that public notices be printed in newspapers could save more than $60 million, the governor’s office says....
abstract: New Jersey State Legislature will conduct hearings on bill to eliminate requirement that government post all public legal notices in newspapers; Democratic lawmakers and newspaper industry officials say proposal came from Gov Chris Christie himself as retaliation against news media; bill could mean millions of dollars in lost advertising revenue for state's struggling newspapers.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New Jersey State League of Municipalities
